text: The oracle that Habakkuk the prophet saw.
speaker: Narrator

text:
O Lord, how long shall I cry for help,
    and you will not hear?
Or cry to you “Violence!”
    and you will not save?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do you make me see iniquity,
    and why do you idly look at wrong?
Destruction and violence are before me;
    strife and contention arise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So the law is paralysed,
    and justice never goes forth.
For the wicked surround the righteous;
    so justice goes forth perverted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Look among the nations, and see;
    wonder and be astounded.
For I am doing a work in your days
    that you would not believe if told.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For behold, I am raising up the Chaldeans,
    that bitter and hasty nation,
who march through the breadth of the earth,
    to seize dwellings not their own.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They are dreaded and fearsome;
    their justice and dignity go forth from themselves.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
They all come for violence,
    all their faces forward.
    They gather captives like sand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
At kings they scoff,
    and at rulers they laugh.
They laugh at every fortress,
    for they pile up earth and take it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then they sweep by like the wind and go on,
    guilty men, whose own might is their god!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Are you not from everlasting,
    O Lord my God, my Holy One?
    We shall not die.
O Lord, you have ordained them as a judgement,
    and you, O Rock, have established them for reproof.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You who are of purer eyes than to see evil
    and cannot look at wrong,
why do you idly look at traitors
    and remain silent when the wicked swallows up
    the man more righteous than he?
speaker: Narrator

text:
You make mankind like the fish of the sea,
    like crawling things that have no ruler.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Is he then to keep on emptying his net
    and mercilessly killing nations for ever?
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will take my stand at my watchpost
    and station myself on the tower,
and look out to see what he will say to me,
    and what I will answer concerning my complaint.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the Lord answered me:
“Write the vision;
    make it plain on tablets,
    so he may run who reads it.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Behold, his soul is puffed up; it is not upright within him,
    but the righteous shall live by his faith.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Moreover, wine is a traitor,
    an arrogant man who is never at rest.
His greed is as wide as Sheol;
    like death he has never enough.
He gathers for himself all nations
    and collects as his own all peoples.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shall not all these take up their taunt against him, with scoffing and riddles for him, and say,
“Woe to him who heaps up what is not his own—
    for how long?—
    and loads himself with pledges!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Will not your debtors suddenly arise,
    and those awake who will make you tremble?
    Then you will be spoil for them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because you have plundered many nations,
    all the remnant of the peoples shall plunder you,
for the blood of man and violence to the earth,
    to cities and all who dwell in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Woe to him who gets evil gain for his house,
    to set his nest on high,
    to be safe from the reach of harm!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For the stone will cry out from the wall,
    and the beam from the woodwork respond.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Woe to him who builds a town with blood
    and founds a city on iniquity!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, is it not from the Lord of hosts
    that peoples labour merely for fire,
    and nations weary themselves for nothing?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the earth will be filled
    with the knowledge of the glory of the Lord
    as the waters cover the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Woe to him who makes his neighbours drink—
    you pour out your wrath and make them drunk,
    in order to gaze at their nakedness!
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will have your fill of shame instead of glory.
    Drink, yourself, and show your uncircumcision!
The cup in the Lord's right hand
    will come round to you,
    and utter shame will come upon your glory!
speaker: Narrator

text:
The violence done to Lebanon will overwhelm you,
    as will the destruction of the beasts that terrified them,
for the blood of man and violence to the earth,
    to cities and all who dwell in them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“What profit is an idol
    when its maker has shaped it,
    a metal image, a teacher of lies?
For its maker trusts in his own creation
    when he makes speechless idols!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Woe to him who says to a wooden thing, Awake;
    to a silent stone, Arise!
Can this teach?
Behold, it is overlaid with gold and silver,
    and there is no breath at all in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the Lord is in his holy temple;
    let all the earth keep silence before him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet, according to Shigionoth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
God came from Teman,
    and the Holy One from Mount Paran.
His splendour covered the heavens,
    and the earth was full of his praise. Selah
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Before him went pestilence,
    and plague followed at his heels.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction;
    the curtains of the land of Midian did tremble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Was your wrath against the rivers, O Lord?
    Was your anger against the rivers,
    or your indignation against the sea,
when you rode on your horses,
    on your chariot of salvation?
speaker: Narrator

text:
You stripped the sheath from your bow,
    calling for many arrows. Selah
    You split the earth with rivers.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The sun and moon stood still in their place
    at the light of your arrows as they sped,
    at the flash of your glittering spear.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You marched through the earth in fury;
    you threshed the nations in anger.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You went out for the salvation of your people,
    for the salvation of your anointed.
You crushed the head of the house of the wicked,
    laying him bare from thigh to neck. Selah
speaker: Narrator

text:
You pierced with his own arrows the heads of his warriors,
    who came like a whirlwind to scatter me,
    rejoicing as if to devour the poor in secret.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You trampled the sea with your horses,
    the surging of mighty waters.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Though the fig tree should not blossom,
    nor fruit be on the vines,
the produce of the olive fail
    and the fields yield no food,
the flock be cut off from the fold
    and there be no herd in the stalls,
speaker: Narrator

text:
yet I will rejoice in the Lord;
    I will take joy in the God of my salvation.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
